He then nailed wooden pegs in the four corners of the spring.
He also poured milk and yogurt into the water of the pond.
He wrote the spell on a golden leaf.
He placed it on a lotus leaf and put it in the spring.
The spell master said:
Good friends, now there are difficulties and calamities.
You have been bound by non-Buddhists.
Now this ritual has been completed.
With the dharani, I protect you.
When you have finished eating and drinking, collect the food and drink.
The lotus leaf, the golden spell, and so on,
immediately throw them into the water.
The spell master breathed out three times.
The binding method of the non-Buddhists immediately disappeared.
The dragon then became liberated and free from difficulties.
The dragon then came out to make offerings to the spell master.
The dragon said:
Master, what instructions do you have?
The spell master said:

original: 汝可每依時節興雲致雨。
analyzed: 汝可每依時節興雲致雨。
translated: You should always, in a timely manner, bring forth clouds and cause rain.
Place this dharani on the top of your head.

original: 令汝永得安樂無諸災難。
analyzed: 令汝永得安樂無諸災難。
translated: It will enable you to always attain peace and joy, and be free from calamities and difficulties.
Thirty-four methods.
If the great waters overflow and harm people,
then the mantra master should chant the mantra twenty-one times.
Scatter it into the great waters.
It will no longer overflow.
The thirty-fifth method.
If one always recites it,
one will quickly attain certainty and be born in the pure lands.
One will forever attain peace and joy.
The thirty-sixth method.

original: 若人日日諸千遍并詰印者。
analyzed: 若人日日諸千遍并詰印者。
translated: If a person recites it a thousand times every day and forms the mudra,
they will attain the vajra body.
In this very life, they will realize the acceptance of the non-arising of dharmas.
The thirty-seventh method.

original: 若人日日誦一百八遍并結印。
analyzed: 若人日日誦一百八遍并結印。
translated: If a person recites it one hundred and eight times every day and forms the mudra,
they will quickly receive a prediction from the buddhas of the ten directions.
It is certain and without doubt.
The thirty-eighth method.

original: 若人四方四面誦二十一遍并結印。
analyzed: 若人四方四面誦二十一遍并結印。
translated: If a person recites it twenty-one times in the four directions and forms the mudra,
for the sake of sentient beings, they should chant their names
and scatter the mudra once.

original: 得一切魔王鬼神毘那夜迦諸惡鬼王龍等。
analyzed: 得一切魔王鬼神毘那夜迦諸惡鬼王龍等。
translated: All the evil kings of māras, ghosts, piśācas, and nāgas will
respectfully love and protect them.
all that is needed will come by itself.
One's complexion will be beautiful.
One's blessings and virtues will be immeasurable and boundless.
The Buddhas of the ten directions will praise one.

original: 何況餘人但制心一處持誦。
analyzed: 何況餘人但制心一處持誦。
translated: How much more so for other people who simply focus their mind in one place and recite the mantra.
One will quickly attain the acceptance of the non-arising of dharmas.
One can be reborn in the pure lands of the ten directions as one wishes.
One will attain buddhahood through lotus flower transformation.
The Separate Methods of the Venerable and Supreme Dhāraṇī
